page.title: 05A Perth riverside walk
page.content: Start at the corner of the North Inch below the Perth Bridge where you can see the Tay's flood markings of past years.You may see salmon fishermen standing in the river trying their luck.Walk along Tay Street,a street of lovely old sandstone buildings. Crossing the railway bridge is good fun,looking down through the cracks in the wood to see the rushing rapids! Steps lead down to Moncrieff Island. Duck under the Queen's Bridge into the lovely Norrie Millar Park with it's ornamental pool. This will lead you back to the Old Bridge passing a council scheme of houses which has won many awards, as it was specially designed to fit this beautiful spot by the bridge.
